basic.floral_language:
Epipremnum aureum 
Floriography: strong, warm-hearted, optimistic
Epipremnum aureum is an evergreen plant with a tenacious vitality, known as the "devil's vine or devil's ivy" for being almost impossible to kill.
Has hypertrophy, green oval leaves, vines have a strong tendency to twist together, well-developed aerial roots can absorb moisture in the air and nutrients. Epipremnum aureum can be hanged in the room, or as a hydroponic plant.
It likes half shaded environments, place under scattered light.

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients or hydroponics
maintenance.sunlight: Resistance to shade plant, put in places with bright scattered light, in winter may take 2-3h sunlight
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, may spray water around the leaves
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly
